conclusion: Determine the change in magnetic flux when the coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
The area vector of the coil is initially perpendicular to the x-axis.
The initial angle between the area vector and the magnetic field is 0°.
After rotating 60° downward, the coil's area vector makes an angle of 60° with the x-axis.
Magnetic flux is given by the formula: Φ = B · A · cos(θ).
Initial magnetic flux Φ_i = 0.1 T × 0.4 m² × 1 = 0.04 Wb.
Final magnetic flux Φ_f = 0.1 T × 0.4 m² × 0.5 = 0.02 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = 0.02 Wb - 0.04 Wb = -0.02 Wb.
